question: Who was king when Daniel was thrown into the lions' den?
explanation: King Darius was tricked into signing a decree that led to Daniel being thrown to the lions.

verses.kjv:
Then the king commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast
him
 into the den of lions.
Now the king spake and said unto Daniel, Thy God whom thou servest continually, he will deliver thee.

question: Which king had a dream about a statue made of different metals?
explanation: Nebuchadnezzar dreamed of a large statue with a head of gold, which Daniel interpreted.

verses.kjv:
Thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. This great image, whose brightness was excellent, stood before thee; and the form thereof
was
 terrible.

question: Which king ordered the execution of John the Baptist?
explanation: Herod Antipas reluctantly ordered John's beheading after his stepdaughter asked for it at her mother's urging.

verses.kjv:
And the king was sorry: nevertheless for the oath’s sake, and them which sat with him at meat, he commanded
it to be given
her.
And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

question: Which king saw handwriting on the wall during a feast?
explanation: During Belshazzar's feast, a hand appeared and wrote on the wall, which Daniel interpreted as a message of judgment.

verses.kjv: In the same hour came forth fingers of a man’s hand, and wrote over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the king’s palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

question: Which king had 700 wives and 300 concubines?
explanation: Solomon had 700 wives of royal birth and 300 concubines, and they led his heart astray.

verses.kjv: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.

question: Which young king found the Book of the Law in the temple and led a great reformation?
explanation: During Josiah's reign, the Book of the Law was found, leading him to institute major religious reforms.

verses.kjv: And Hilkiah the high priest said unto Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and he read it.

question: Who was king of Israel when Elijah prophesied?
explanation: Ahab son of Omri reigned over Israel, and Elijah confronted him about worshiping Baal.

verses.kjv: And in the thirty and eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty and two years.

question: Which Persian king allowed the Jews to return and rebuild Jerusalem?
explanation: Cyrus king of Persia issued a decree allowing the Jews to return and rebuild the temple in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv:
Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and
put it also in writing, saying,
Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, The LORD God of heaven hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged me to build him an house at Jerusalem, which
is in Judah.

question: How many years did King David reign over Israel?
explanation: David was thirty when he became king, and he reigned forty years total.

verses.kjv:
David
was thirty years old when he began to reign,
and
 he reigned forty years.

question: Which king tore his robe when he heard the words of the Law?
explanation: When the king heard the words of the Book of the Law, he tore his robes in repentance.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he rent his clothes.

question: Which king was restored to sanity after seven years of madness?
explanation: At the end of seven years, Nebuchadnezzar's sanity was restored and he praised the Most High.

verses.kjv:
And at the end of the days I Nebuchadnezzar lifted up mine eyes unto heaven, and mine understanding returned unto me, and I blessed the most High, and I praised and honoured him that liveth for ever, whose dominion
is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom
is from generation to generation:

question: Which king ordered a census that angered God?
explanation: The anger of the Lord burned against Israel, and he incited David to take a census.

verses.kjv: And again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them to say, Go, number Israel and Judah.

question: Who was the mother of King Solomon?
explanation: David comforted Bathsheba his wife, and she gave birth to a son, and they named him Solomon.

verses.kjv: And David comforted Bath-sheba his wife, and went in unto her, and lay with her: and she bare a son, and he called his name Solomon: and the LORD loved him.

question: Who was king when Jesus was born?
explanation: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod.

verses.kjv: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem,

question: Who was the last king of united Israel before the kingdom split?
explanation: Solomon died and his son Rehoboam succeeded him, but the kingdom divided during Rehoboam's reign.

verses.kjv: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.

question: Who was king when the walls of Jerusalem were rebuilt by Nehemiah?
explanation: Nehemiah served as cupbearer to King Artaxerxes and received permission to rebuild Jerusalem's walls.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king,
that wine
was before him: and I took up the wine, and gave
it unto the king. Now I had not been
beforetime sad in his presence.

question: Which king sought wisdom from the witch of Endor?
explanation: King Saul disguised himself and consulted a medium at Endor to bring up the spirit of Samuel.

verses.kjv:
Then said Saul unto his servants, Seek me a woman that hath a familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and enquire of her. And his servants said to him, Behold,
there is a woman that hath a familiar spirit at Endor.

question: Which king's pride caused him to lose his sanity?
explanation: Nebuchadnezzar was driven away from people and ate grass like the ox until he acknowledged God.

verses.kjv:
The same hour was the thing fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar: and he was driven from men, and did eat grass as oxen, and his body was wet with the dew of heaven, till his hairs were grown like eagles
feathers, and his nails like birds’
claws.

question: Which king tore down the high places and idols in Judah?
explanation: King Josiah ordered the high priest to remove articles made for Baal and Asherah from the temple.

verses.kjv:
And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the door, to bring forth out of the temple of the LORD all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the grove, and for all the host of heaven: and he burned them without Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them unto Bethel.
And he put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places round about Jerusalem; them also that burned incense unto Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the host of heaven.

question: Which king saw the handwriting on the wall?
explanation: Suddenly the fingers of a human hand appeared and wrote on the wall during Belshazzar's feast.

verses.kjv: In the same hour came forth fingers of a man’s hand, and wrote over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the king’s palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

question: How many years did Solomon reign in Jerusalem?
explanation: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.

verses.kjv:
And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel
was forty years.

question: How tall was King Saul?
choices: A head taller than anyone else
explanation: He had a son named Saul, as handsome a young man as could be found, and he was a head taller than anyone else.

verses.kjv:
And he had a son, whose name
was Saul, a choice young man, and a goodly: and
there was not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward
he was higher than any of the people.

question: Which king had a dream about a statue made of different materials?
explanation: Your Majesty looked, and there before you stood a large statue—an enormous, dazzling statue, awesome in appearance.

verses.kjv:
Thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. This great image, whose brightness was excellent, stood before thee; and the form thereof
was
 terrible.

question: Which king consulted a medium at Endor?
explanation: Saul then said to his attendants, 'Find me a woman who is a medium, so I may go and inquire of her.'

verses.kjv:
Then said Saul unto his servants, Seek me a woman that hath a familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and enquire of her. And his servants said to him, Behold,
there is a woman that hath a familiar spirit at Endor.

question: Which king was told by Nathan the prophet, 'You are the man!'?
explanation: Then Nathan said to David, 'You are the man!' This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says.

verses.kjv:
And Nathan said to David, Thou
art the man. Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, I anointed thee king over Israel, and I delivered thee out of the hand of Saul;

question: What happened to Absalom during the battle?
choices: His hair got caught in a tree
He was struck by a sword
explanation: Absalom's hair got caught in the tree. He was left hanging in midair, while the mule he was riding kept on going.

verses.kjv:
And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that
was under him went away.

question: What did God offer Solomon before he asked for wisdom?
explanation: At Gibeon the Lord appeared to Solomon during the night in a dream, and God said, 'Ask for whatever you want me to give you.'

verses.kjv: In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night: and God said, Ask what I shall give thee.

question: Which king tore his robes when he heard the Book of the Law?
explanation: When King Josiah heard the words of the Book of the Law, he tore his robes in repentance.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he rent his clothes.
